name: Odense
fun_fact: Fun fact: Hans Christian Andersen was born in Odense in 1805, and the city is obsessed with him - you'll find Little Mermaid sculptures, Ugly Duckling references, and a museum dedicated to his life. He wrote 156 fairy tales that have been translated into over 125 languages!

hero_dishes.description: Funen-style apple cake with layers of stewed apples, breadcrumbs, and whipped cream
hero_dishes.origin_story: Funen (Odense's island) is known for its orchards - this simple dessert celebrates local apples
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional Danish restaurants, bakeries, home kitchens

food_culture_notes: Storms Pakhus is a former warehouse now housing food stalls and craft beer
Funen is called 'Denmark's garden' for its fertile farmland and orchards
Hygge (cozy contentment) defines the dining culture - candles, warmth, togetherness
New Nordic cuisine influence reaches even traditional restaurants
